content.value: The process of creating copies of data to protect against loss and restoring that data when needed.
content.example: Example: Restoring files after accidental deletion or system failure.

content.value: Data loss can happen due to hardware failure, accidental deletion, malware, or system crashes. Backups ensure that important data can be recovered quickly.
Why Backup and Recovery Are Important
Data loss can happen due to hardware failure, accidental deletion, malware, or system crashes. Backups ensure that important data can be recovered quickly.

items: Full backup – Copies all selected data
Incremental backup – Copies only changed data
Differential backup – Copies data changed since last full backup

content.value: A backup strategy defines how often backups are taken, where they are stored, and how recovery is performed.
content.example: Example: Daily backups stored on a remote server.
